page.title: 10Crime Rate
page.content: An interview at the police station revealed that the crime rate in Louth has fallen in recent years.The most common crimes reported were thefts burglary,and criminal damage.The least common crimes are rape and murder,the last reported murder occurred about seven years ago. Most criminals seem to be in the 18 to 25 age group and they are predominantly male, however, female crimes are on the increase. Despite the fall in the overall crime rate,drinking offences have increased over the last year.In 1984 there were 43 reported drinking offences but in 1985 there have been 42 cases recorded up to the beginning of June. The police station is situated on Eastgate.It has one female and four male cells for offenders.The cells are sometimes full,usually at weekends.
